alert.note: Alert for San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 12 at 4:56PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT EAST CENTRAL CATRON COUNTY THROUGH 530 PM MDT... At 455 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southeast of Old Horse Springs, or 28 miles northwest of Poverty Creek, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to vegetation is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Catron County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If threatening weather approaches your area, take shelter in a sturdy building. Accumulations of small hail on roads can create very slick and hazardous driving conditions.

area.areaDesc: San Agustin Plains and Adjacent Lowlands; Southwest Mountains
